lines.text: There's two places they send people who are havin' too good a time. One's church, the other's prison. And I done time in both, Jack.
You can't kill the devil, Jack.
The fella' in the fancy suit must have a name.
You know, Jack? I can usually tell in about two minutes all I need to know about a person.
Like is he a loser? Does he shoot dope? Does he like to wear ladies' underwear?
Are you telling me that you're a psychic, or that you like to look at people's pants?
Now you just sit tight a minute while I go right a wrong.
How the hell did you get dumped in the middle of nowhere?
A fella' in a big rig picked me up, about where you passed me. But he got a little too devoted, you know what I mean?

I figured you'd be long gone by now. You must've lost your appetite in a big hurry, huh? I'd hate to think it's 'cause you didn't like me, Jack. I mean, you can see what an unfriendly place the world can be.
I got no place to sleep, Jack.
I'll tell on ya, Jack. I'll tell everyone what you got in that briefcase. Don't worry. I'm a man with a secret too myself.
